intro: Mapania gabonica, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves with a dense central cluster of blooms. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Mapania gabonica thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
